text: Rant about my school s new grading system  So all of the schools in my district have adopted a new grading system   The lowest grade you can get is DNM  or Does Not Meet  Above that is a P  or Partial  Above P is M for Meets  and then E for exceeds  When I first saw this  it made sense  But the teachers at my high school have changes into this weird individual based grading system  Basically  they decided that Meet didn t mean that you met the standard  but met their expectation of you  That means that if a teacher thinks that you will exceed on a standard  you will get an M if you do exceed  This essentially penalizes you for consistently doing well  and rewarding you for doing bad most of the time  but doing well occasionally  Because of this new system  I can t get an E grade anymore because that s what the teacher expects of me  Now  since no human can keep up with doing significantly more work than required for more than a few months  I have become burned out   I can t constantly exceed  so now I m getting partial grades for meeting the standard  while other students are getting exceed grades for doing barely anything  because they don t do good all of the time And that s the end of the rant  I just needed to get that off of my chest
summary: The new grading system at my high school penalizes students for consistently doing well and rewards them for occasionally exceeding the standard. I can't get an E grade anymore because that's what the teacher expects of me. I'm getting partial grades for meeting the standard and exceed grades for doing nothing at all.
cleaned: new grade system high school penalize student consistently reward occasionally exceed standard not grade anymore teacher expect get partial grade meet standard exceed grade
